home.title: Maracaibo Solo Helper
home.play1: Play a Maracaibo solo game against Jean or Jacques, the solo opponents.
home.play2: You can play with or without the expansion The Uprising.

jean.intro: Setup the game up as for a 2-player game, with the following changes:
jean.setupMarkers: Setup her ship, explorer, victory point marker and influence markers as usual.
jean.noFigures: She does not use her figures.
jean.noShipBoard: She doesn't need a ship board.
jean.noDoubloons: She does not collect doubloons or combat points.
jean.noProjectCards: She does not receive any project cards at the start of the game.
jean.automaNote: The Automa board and Automa cards are not required, they are managed by the application.

jacques.intro: Setup the game according to the human player count. If you play solo, setup as a 2-player game.
jacques.noPlayerMaterial: Jacques does not use any player material.
jacques.victoryPointMarker: Place his victory point marker on space 0 of the victory point track
jacques.explorerMarker: Place his explorer marker on the start of the explorer track.
jacques.automaNote: Jacques' Automa cards are not required, they are managed by the application.

turnBot.cityMarketSpace:
Place disc from supply
in free market space

endOfRound.title: End of Round {round}
endOfRound.botVP: During income, Jean gains {count} victory point. | During income, Jean gains {count} victory points.

endOfGame.title: End of Game

table.explorerStepsAhead: Number of steps Jean's explorer is ahead of yours*

endOfGame.explorerNote: * If the explorers are on different branches of the path, count how far each explorer is away from the next barrier. The explorer who needs fewer spaces to reach the barrier counts as 'ahead'.

moveShip.title: Move Ship
moveShip.upperRoute: If there is a choice: use the upper route.
moveShip.lowerRoute: If there is a choice: use the lower route.
moveShip.ignoreVillages: Jean ignores all villages without quests. These are not-counted spaces! This means that Jean will always end her movement in either a city or a location with a quest.
moveShip.cannotSkipHand: Jean cannot skip locations with the hand symbol, such as the 'homeward bound' spaces. This means that once she reaches space 20, she only every moves to the next space.
moveShip.legacyTiles: If legacy tiles reveal new cities, these also count for Jean.

vp.title: Victory Points
vp.get: Jean gains {amount} victory point. | Jean gains {amount} victory points.

reduceCombat.title: Pay Combat Points
reduceCombat.reduce: Pay {amount} combat point. | Pay {amount} combat points.
reduceCombat.noPoints: If you cannot, enter in the text field how many combat points you could actually pay. Jean scores {amount} VP for each missing combat point.

questPile.title: Take Quest Tile
questPile.take: Jean removes a quest tile from the pile.

removeDisc.title: Remove Disc
removeDisc.remove: Jean removes a disc for ship upgrades (managed by the application).

explore.title: Move Explorer
explore.move: Jean moves her explorer {amount} spaces forward.
explore.quest: If a quest tile is within her movement limit, she moves to it and stops (forgoing any additional movement).
explore.shortestPath: Otherwise, she always chooses the shortest path.
explore.noRewards: Jean doesn't get any rewards for crossing barriers or reaching the end of the explorer track, however she does reduce your explorer's bonuses.

instruction.modifyValue: Determine the modified combat value for each nation. For each nation, first add Jean's noble rank with that nation to the combat value indicated by the combat token. Then subtract your noble rank with that nation from the total. Noble ranks are the last red band you or Jean reached on the corresponding influence track. If the combat token shows a requirement that modifies a nation's combat value, then apply it. Jean ignores any costs or immediate bonuses on the combat token.
instruction.tie: In case of a tie, Jean chooses the nation with the highest combat value on the combat token (ignoring any modifications or bonuses). If there is still a tie, she preferentially chooses France, then Spain and finally England.
instruction.annexCity: Jean now annexes the lowest-numbered, empty city (without receiving the reward shown on the flag of this city). If there aren't any empty cities, she annexes the lowest-numbered empty village instead. If there aren't any of those either, then she removes the ownership marker from the game.
instruction.annexVillage: Jean annexes an additional empty village according to the rules above.
instruction.influence: Finally, Jean gets the indicated influence with the nation she fought with.

explore.title: Move Explorer
explore.move: Jacques moves his explorer {amount} space forward. | Jacques moves his explorer {amount} spaces forward.
explore.quest: If a quest tile is within his movement limit, he moves to it and stops (forgoing any additional movement).
explore.shortestPath: Otherwise, he always chooses the shortest path.
explore.noRewards: Jacques doesn't get any rewards for crossing barriers or reaching the end of the explorer track, however he does reduce your explorer's bonuses.

cityDisc.title: Place City Disc
cityDisc.place: Jacques adds a disc from the supply to the market of the city with number {cityNumber}.
cityDisc.noPlace: This does not happen if the location‘s market is full.

vp.title: Victory Points
vp.get: Jacques gains {amount} victory point. | Jacques gains {amount} victory points.

action.abortGameConfirm: Aborting the running game - are you sure?
action.endGameConfirm: End this game and return to home screen - are you sure?

serviceWorkerUpdatedRefresh.title: Refresh Application
serviceWorkerUpdatedRefresh.notice: The application was updated - do you want to refresh to use the latest version?
